name: The Melbourne Buildings Scarf
description:
Retro-chic classic traveller's scarf features Coote's colourful sketches of Melbourne's Town Hall, Magistrates Court, GPO, Flinders Street Station, St Pauls Cathedral, Manchester Unity Building, Le Louvre, Baptist Church, Shrine of Remembrance, Immigration Museum and State Library. See it folded or see the whole collection at www.melbournestyle.com.au

100% SILK 97x97cm

name: The Melbourne Book - A History of Now
description:
'The Melbourne Book- A History of Now' first published in 2003, has recently enjoyed its first major update. New hard cover, New chapters on Melbourne's street art and design culture, food and fashion... New tales from Melbourne's short but amazing history. New tales of Melbourne's physical, cultural, architectural, historical and mythical features. New photographs of this ever-changing city. 
Over 700 photos, over 60 tales of the city. The must-have Melburnian's manual; it's the world's most liveable book. It's all home grown, homemade, indie publishing, and made with love. 368 pages, great value, $55. Go to www.melbournestyle.com.au to see more of this book and its contents.

name: The Melbourne Cup & Saucer
description:
Chic black and white designs on fine china. THE MELBOURNE CUP&SAUCER, the great race day favourite. Other designs include:
GEE-GEES CUP&SAUCER, for lovers of horseflesh.
MELBOURNE BUILDINGS CUP&SAUCER: the city's icons in silhouette. 
MELBOURNE ALPHABET CUP&SAUCER: pictographs of the city's favourite places and themes. See them all at www.melbournestyle.com.au

name: G'DAY POSTCARDS PACK
description: G'DAY. Postcard packs, mixed designs, 10 cards in each pack, and every one is equally as happy to see you. See all the designs in the pack at www.melbournestyle.com.au

name: The Melbourne Map Soaps
description:
MELBOURNE MAP SOAP. Get Lost, Stay Clean. Complete with a teeny tiny plaz tram tag. 
See all the other Melbourne soaps at www.melbournestyle.com.au
